message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s findings are consistent with Edwards syndrome or trisomy 18. This condition is associated with advanced maternal age, and the majority of patients die within the first year of life. It is more common in females, and thrombocytopenia is a common hematologic abnormality in these patients.

This condition is associated with advanced maternal age, has a much higher mortality, and is more commonly seen in females. Thrombocytopenia is a common hematologic abnormality in these patients, not the least common.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The description matches the features of Edward syndrome (trisomy 18), which is caused by the presence of an extra copy of chromosome 18. This condition is associated with advanced maternal age, not teenage mothers. The survival rate is poor, with 95% of affected infants dying in the first year of life. The condition affects both males and females. Thrombocytopenia is a common hematologic abnormality in these patients.

The physical examination findings described are consistent with Edwards syndrome (trisomy 18), which is caused by the presence of an extra copy of chromosome 18. This condition is not associated with teenage mothers and is not more common in males.
